questions.clue: In 'Romeo and Juliet', this friend of Romeo dies in a duel with Tybalt.
Banquo is a loyal companion to this title character until he is murdered on his orders.
In 'Much Ado About Nothing', this soldier is a close friend of Benedick and the Prince.
This character, a companion of Othello, is manipulated into jealousy and murder by Iago.
In 'The Tempest', this jester, along with Stephano, plots to overthrow Prospero.
This invention by James Watt improved the efficiency of early engines and powered factories and transportation.
Eli Whitney invented this machine in 1793 to separate cotton fibers from seeds, revolutionizing the cotton industry.
This innovation by Henry Bessemer in the 1850s significantly reduced the cost of steel production.
Invented by Edmund Cartwright, this powered device mechanized the weaving process, increasing textile production.
This 18th-century innovation, developed by Richard Arkwright, used water power to drive spinning machinery.
This 1931 painting by Salvador Dalí features melting clocks in a surreal desert landscape.
Created in 1962, this Andy Warhol artwork depicts multiple images of a famous actress in bright colors.
This abstract painting by Piet Mondrian, completed in 1942, is known for its grid of black lines and primary colors.
In 1937, Pablo Picasso created this powerful mural-sized painting depicting the horrors of the Spanish Civil War.
This Marcel Duchamp artwork from 1917, consisting of a porcelain urinal, challenged traditional notions of art.
This gas is released by baking powder, causing baked goods to rise.
When you boil eggs, this process causes the whites to turn solid.
The Maillard reaction is responsible for this effect seen on grilled meats.
This is the term for the temperature at which a liquid begins to solidify.
This chemical process in bread-making converts sugars into alcohol and carbon dioxide.
This river in Egypt is often considered the longest river in the world.
This river is the longest in South America and has the largest drainage basin in the world.
This river, known as the 'Father of Waters,' flows over 2,300 miles from Minnesota to the Gulf of Mexico.
This European river flows through or borders 10 countries, more than any other river in the world.
This Asian river, considered sacred in Hinduism, is heavily polluted despite efforts to clean it.

final.clue: This speech, delivered on March 8, 1854, argued against the expansion of slavery in the territories and helped shape the Republican Party's platform.
final.answer: What is the Peoria Speech (by Abraham Lincoln)?
